item.description: ozunconf18 html{ margin: 0; height: 100%; overflow: hidden; } iframe{ position: absolute; left:0; right:0; bottom:0; top:0; border:0; }

rOpenSci code of conduct The organisers of the Melbourne rOpenSci Unconference are committed to providing a welcoming and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

R OpenSci ozunconference 2018 Projects :question::memo::black_nib:tl - tl;dr documentation for r functions :mortar_board::page_facing_up:vitae - automated CV functions and templates :school::chart_with_upwards_trend::sparkles:learngganimate - a guide to all things gganimate:books: :baby::name_badge:ozbabynames - popular Australian baby names by sex, state and year :blue_book::mag:simpletextr - makes Natural Language Processing simple :earth_americas::repeat::earth_asia:geoflowr - animating geographical flows :computer::mag:jerbs - scraping and tidying Department of employment and jobs website :speech_balloon:reviewer - better track changes and reviewing experience in R markdown:memo: :rainbow:genderrecoder - helpers for managing complex free-text gender entry data:busts_in_silhouette::arrow_right::woman::man::rainbow: :package::whale2:containerit - package your analysis with Docker :walking:rwalkable - how walkable is a neighbourhood :bird::speech_balloon:UntweetdAus - tweeting underappreciated endangered species:ant::bug::snake: :book::left_right_arrow::pencil:syn - a synonym package :clipboard::paperclip:bindertools - Easy initiation of R binders on github:open_file_folder: If there are any projects that you know are missing please fork this document on GitHub, make changes, and then send a pull request.

rOpenSci unconf terms and conditions These terms and conditions apply to the rOpenSci ozunconference 2018 (“Event”) hosted by and on behalf of The rOpenSci project, a fiscally sponsored project of Numfocus Inc, a non-profit registered in Texas (P.O. Box 90596 Austin, TX 78709 USA). The purpose of the Event is to encourage development of open source tools and grow a community of open source developers and mentors around the R programming language.
